unit_learning_outcomes.description: Use knowledge of key trade-offs to appreciate the limits of macroeconomic policies.
Critically evaluate the relationship between macroeconomic policies and key macroeconomic indicators, such as inflation, growth, interest rates, and stock market indices.
Apply knowledge of the dynamic path of key economic variables in response to macroeconomic policies in order to communicate the analysis to a diverse audience.
Evaluate key macroeconomic policies, their objectives and instruments faced by practitioners and economists.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to read all assigned papers before attending each weekly seminar.

enrolment_rules.description: ECON633 or ECON6033 or ECON649 or ECON6049 or ECON991 or ECON8091

assessments.description: The presentation, taking place in Week 12, will be broadly based on macroeconomic policies and implications. Students will work in groups to  prepare a joint 30-minute presentation and 5-10 minutes of class discussion. Each group member is expected to conduct part of the presentation and participate in the discussion, to receive an individual mark of 20%.
A two-hour closed book final exam will be held during the University Examination Period. The exam will consist of conceptual and problem solving short and long answer questions.

A two-hour closed-book test will take place in class time, and will include multiple choice questions, essay, or problem solving questions, and will be based on topics studied in the first half of the session.

data.description: The objective of this unit is to investigate macroeconomic policies that are important to the aggregate economy. These policies may include monetary policies, fiscal policies, macro-prudential policies and exchange rate policies. We will use the workhorse models in macroeconomics to analyse the implications of these policies. Issues in policy designs are then discussed, particularly in regard to the global financial crisis of 2008–2009. Industry researchers will be engaged to discuss the industry perspective on these policies.
data.title: Applied Macroeconomic Policy

title: Applied Macroeconomic Policy
